channel.title: ACT on Quiet time notes
channel.description: Recent content in ACT on Quiet time notes

item.title: ACT 24
item.description: ACT 24:25 Felix was probably pricked to the heart because he was lacking in these characteristics just like John the Baptist to Herod. Although Felix had an accurate understanding of Christianity Related verses: Acts 24:25. See notes

item.title: ACT 21
item.description: ACT 21:8 Philip the evangelist lived in Caesarea and had 4 virgin daughters who had the gift of prophecy. Which means all five were believers and had the Holy Spirit operating in their lives Related verses: Acts 21:8-9. See notes

item.title: ACT 20
item.description: ACT 20:24 I will be able to fulfill my ministry if I don’t consider my life of any value Related verses: Acts 20:24. See notes ACT 20:11 Paul spoke from the previous day past midnight even until daybreak Related verses: Acts 20:11. See notes ACT 20:9 Apostle Paul was not stingy with words. A learned man. Gifted in articulation of words and full of power. A great servant of Jesus. A devotee and lover of God who was ready to murder for God until he encountered Jesus on the road to Damascus

item.title: ACT 19
item.description: ACT 19:30 Radical Related verses: Acts 19:30. See notes ACT 19:14 Being the son of a high priest guarantees nothing. A personal relationship with Jesus is all that is needed Related verses: Acts 19:14. See notes ACT 19:13 They didn’t know Jesus personally so the name of Jesus didn’t work for them. The name of Jesus us more than just the name. It includes his person, attributes, character and requires a personal relationship with him which comes by revelation

item.title: ACT 15
item.description: ACT 15:32 Judas (Barsabbas) and Silas (Silvanus) were prophets Related verses: Acts 15:32. See notes

item.title: ACT 14
item.description: ACT 14:23 In choosing leaders of the church for the work of the ministry, there were prayer and fasting involved. First in Jesus choosing the Apostles, then in the church commissioning Paul and Barnabas then in Paul choosing elders in each church they had preached in e.g. Antioch, Lystra, Derbe Related verses: Acts 14:23. See notes

item.title: ACT 11
item.description: ACT 11:26 They met in the the church. A physical place Related verses: Acts 11:26. See notes

item.title: ACT 10
item.description: ACT 10:20 The Holy Spirit sent an angel to Cornelius to send men to Peter and the Holy Spirit spoke to Peter himself. Could this be because Peter was saved and Cornelius wasn’t yet saved. Meaning the Holy Spirit speaks to the believers only. Related verses: Acts 10:19-20. See notes ACT 10:8 Cornelius explanation ensured that the work would be carried out effectively. Related verses: Acts 10:8. See notes ACT 10:4 Cornelius prayer and offering invoked the mercy of God to see that he and his family received salvation even though he was a Roman officer.

item.title: ACT 9
item.description: ACT 9:25 Saul had gained disciples in the space of three years Related verses: Acts 9:25. See notes ACT 9:17 Saul had become born again and was praying but Ananias had to go to him to lay hands on him not just to receive his sight but to be filled with the Holy Spirit. When Philip the evangelist preached in Samaria, Apostle Peter and John had to come and lay hands on the people of Samaria to receive the Holy Spirit.

item.title: ACT 7
item.description: ACT 7:59 The spirit of man goes to heaven. The soul goes to hell, the body perishes on the earth Related verses: Ecclesiastes 12:7, Luke 23:46, Acts 7:59. See notes ACT 7:33 To take off one?s shoe is to show respect and humility. Slaves in old times didn?t wear sandals. Only their masters did and the slaves were required to stoop down to untie the master?s sandals. In so doing.

item.title: ACT 1
item.description: ACT 1:1 I must do before teaching Related verses: Matthew 23:3, Acts 1:1. See notes ACT 1:1 Written by Luke to Theophilus. Jesus first began to do, then he taught. Preaching of salvation should first be from Jerusalem then to the rest of the world Related verses: Acts 1:1. See notes

item.title: ACT 12
item.description: ACT 12:22 Mercy I must be careful to prevent people from worshiping me. when this happens it means I have become very proud to the point of being destroyed. I must always give the glory to God Related verses: Acts 12:22-23. See notes

item.title: ACT 5
item.description: ACT 5:4 The Holy spirit is God. Lying to him is lying to God and that has grave consequences Related verses: Acts of the Apostles 5:4. See notes

item.title: ACT 2
item.description: ACT 2:33 The Trinity mentioned here. God the Father gave the son the Holy spirit to pour out on me so that I can be like the son. Related verses: Acts of the Apostles 2:33. See notes ACT 2:6 The Holy spirit draws people of different nations. He bridges the gap between people. Pray for the Holy spirit Related verses: ACTS 2:6. See notes ACT 2:2 They 120 were probably in the temple and not the upper room as explained from the NASB study Bible.

item.title: ACT 28
item.description: ACT 28:8 Healing is not just for sicknesses and diseases caused by demons but all sicknesses including fever and dysentery. Paul prayed then laid his hands on the sick man. Related verses: ACTS 28:8. See notes

item.title: ACT 16
item.description: ACT 16:4 The Apostles and the elders of the church gave out the decrees. Paul, Silas and Timothy simply delivered it for them to observe Related verses: ACTS 16:4. See notes ACT 16:14 Lydia was the first recorded convert in Europe. She was already a worshipper of God but needed to be saved by the preaching of the gospel. God opened her heart and she received the gospel of salvation

item.title: ACT 13
item.description: ACT 13:31 Jesus appeared to the people who cane up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. These were his true disciples. Only those who were present had the privilege of seeing him after he resurrected and also became witnesses. Related verses: ACTS 13:31. See notes

item.title: ACT 4
item.description: ACT 4:3 Just after they had received the Holy Spirit and Peter had won 3000 souls, a lame man has also been healed and Peter and John had their first recorded prison experience. It is inevitable to walk in Jesus anointing and not be persecuted. Jesus had warned previously that if they can do that to the master, the disciples should get ready to experience the same. Related verses: ACTS 4:3.
